comments.commentBody:
Two words....Long Johns
(especially winter silk ones)

Be happy it was -18F here a couple of weeks ago.
The best thing that can happen to the Deep South is a week or two of this weather.

reminds me of a harsh December I spent in San Diego. The town is dependent on the sun for heat, and the coldest month is December. Since it's so temperate the rest of the year, my house was very open & drafty. Temperatures in the forties at night, with little insulation, minimal heating, drafty... It's easy to dismiss, but really was not easy. Warm and toasty here in the Northeast again.

Re. - M.Robbie McMann (#2)
20° F. is a Canadian type of cold? I WISH!! But you are definitely right. If you are used to it and your buildings and their heating systems are made for it, the temperatures can be lived with. But I somehow doubt that Georgians has the same insulation and furnaces that we have here.

I was going to post a snarky comment about how southerners are wimps when it gets a little "cool" down there.  Then I remembered my trip to Atlanta last July.  It was so hot I thought I would die.  Best if I just mind my own business.

This Country, USA, is being controlled by well connected and organized groups of very, very wealthy individuals operating behind the scenes. These group not only control the majority of resources in USA and make life hell on earth for average Americans (99% of them), they also collaborate with dictators all over the world who are also wreaking havoc on they own citizens (99%of them)!

The organized billionaires are currently running the shows at the Federal Reserve Bank, Treasury, Whitehouse, Senate, Congress and US Supreme Court because the people (elected/nominated/appointed) in these institutions are serving their interests. They control the flow of information the public they think people need to know by dominating the media outlets! They do not have to be Republicans, Democrats or Independents because they have the means to operate from every front. They do not represent anyone else except themselves and their friends. Period!

I have been unemployed for five years now. My daughter is stuck with a securitized predatory student loan which was advanced by CITIBANK'S Vikram PANDIT. We all know CITIBANK and other BIG banks got bailed out in 2008. Other than giving themselves huge bonuses from the bailouts, they have not created any jobs!
Mayor Bloomberg will not change a thing for people like me by being the president of United States. I do not think understand or care about the average people who only want to work for a living. They see use as sources of income!

Just what the country needs. A blathering billionaire telling us what's wrong with us. NOT. I would stay home on election day before I would vote for him for President. He is arrogant to the max. His recent choice for Chancellor shows the way he thinks. And with his media empire, comparisons to Berlusconi come immediately to mind.
uhhh, why is wall street touted as a success when they are robbing us blind?  Oh, Im just a naive investor that can't get special tax status because I contribute lavishly to congress.

A transgender person's life is just that day to day like anyone else. What I see/read here is a celebration of the commoditization/mercantile possibilities of the titillating aspects of something outside the normative as if that really exists.

Partly to blame is the Academic Industrial Complex, whose true mission (as separate from its stated mission) is to generate demand for its astronomically expensive product. The pressure to gain acceptance at elite ongoing institutions, like Ivy League colleges, is a fulfillment of this mission. For high schools, the pressure begins ever earlier, since the best way to advertise their worth is with the annual list of acceptances to elite colleges.

But mostly to blame are the parents who buy into this mission hook, line, and sinker. Recent studies have shown that there is no correlation in this country between professional success (as measured in economic terms) and where a college degree comes from or how much that education costs. Yet parents continue to equate high-priced, elite education with success. Indeed, so stubborn are parents in this regard that so-called lower tier colleges have raised their tuitions to attract more demand!

Excellent alternatives exist in abundance, but human nature seems programmed to ignore them. Here in NYC, the saying goes that if there's no line out the door, then there's nothing inside worth waiting for.

Two words of advice to parents: wake up!

I'm sorry I missed a recent screening of this movie in my community. But I find its subject an interesting juxtaposition to how far behind our kids are internationally compared to the top-performing students of the world, as evidenced by yesterday's news about Shanghai students' high performance on the PISA test. The US came in 23rd. Maybe we need to focus less on extra curriculars and more on academics.

No matter how pressured your children's live might be, I certainly hope that they will learn the correct use of apostrophes, possessives, and plurals. Perhaps they might even learn how to use a dictionary. It's appalling to read many of the posted comments by avowedly well-educated parents who apparently can't differentiate between it's and its (to say nothing of disfunctional [sic]) .There is nothing elitist about paying close attention to spelling and grammar.

More startling world news about the dysfunctional upside down executive branch of the government. Mrs. Clinton is making a fool of herself, and Obama..well, he just does not care (at least about the bad guys). But listen to him blame other democracy's for the problems of the world. What is this about?? Is he afraid of blaming the true bad guys?
ah yes, the Democrats love to look the other way when genocide is occurring dont they...

I tried WNW for the Walden to Madison clue, but it didn't seem to work. Everything else was very nicely done. Byron usually gives me fits but this one fit just fine.

@Kevin, don't know if this counts, but I once yelled for "Pulcinella" at a Lynyrd Skynyrd concert.

All these Liu Xiaobo bashers (especially the chinese gov't) totally misunderstand what the Nobel Peace Prize really is about. It is supposed to be controversial, that's the whole point! The goal is to produce rational (not irrational) debates among the human race about issues that are mutually important (albeit conflicting) in a world where humans come in contact with one another.

My high school debate team is better at preparing more logical and rational arguments than the national gov't of China! I would invite China's propaganda chief to my school to witness how rational humans debate about controversial issues

No wonder why the U.S. government and others want this guy .... he's exposing the disgusting truth about warfare, a very "profitable" industry.  We, as Americans can't possibly make decisions based on the tainted media (owned by fewer and fewer Corporations ... Ex: The new NBC/Comcast merger).  If we claim to support a "free press", we MUST have access to the good, the bad and the ugly. We need to read every possible story, and then decide for OURSELVES how to process that information.

Two Points:
I don't think Liu Xiaobo deserves the Nobel Prize. Too often the Peace Prize has been awarded for political reasons, for people who fit a certain political profile dictated by Western ideology. In doing so, the prize committee missed the point of a "peace prize".
That said, I also don't think Liu Xiaobo deserves to be in prison. I don't agree with what he advocates, but I respect his rights to free speech guaranteed under the constitution of the People's Republic of China. If the Chinese government believes they are on the right path, why are they afraid of dissent? Their reaction is a sign of weakness and lack of confidence in their system. In particular, their reaction to the awarding of the prize is totally unnecessary. If they disagree with the choice, just state their opposition and ignore all the Western rhetoric would be sufficient. Such a high-profile attack on the award from all levels of government simply gives the West more ammunition to criticize China.

here is some info regarding Liu Xiaobu receiving fund from NED, unfortunately those link become invalid from NED site after people start to pay attention to it.

http://xahlee.org...

Have you guys changed how you serve up the premium crosswords? I haven't been able to download any new ones since Monday's on my iphone app (2 Across), which has otherwise worked fine for over two years. I'd rather not buy the official app as I've already paid for the entire year through the website.
At last, WikiLekas is showing some guts and revealing the secrets of other goverments.  Let's hope for a trove of documents from China, North Lrea, and Iran.

While majority of our Chinese people are working so hard to improve our lives and to improve the stability of our country. What did Liu Xiaobo do? Oh, he is trying to help the western powers to colonize China for 300 years. In China, some people call him 300liu. LOL. Now,the support of Liu Xiaobo from the west just makes Chinese people think that westerners still did not give up the thoughts of "colonize" China. That is bad, really bad. It hurts Chinese people's feelings for our grandfathers, grand-grand fathers sacrifice their lives in defending the country.

Nowadays, China is different. And those comments about "fascist" is so rude and ignorant. China has its own culture and its own way of thinking. Why are there so many people wanting us to think in the way western people think. Don't Chinese people have to a right to keep their culture? We are nice to foreigners and hold no hostile attitudes towards other countries, anyone who has been China should know that. Those who are trying to interfere China internal affairs are real fascist. China wants only peace and harmony.

Yes, Chinese government does have many problems. But they are working to improve it. NO government in the world is perfect. All countries have their problems. Why don't each country just focus on solving their own issue first. Why always target on China? Just because we think differently from western point of view? If there is true democracy in the west, why the west cannot tolerate Chinese way of thinking? Stop being so hypocritical.

Liu did not nothing to his motherland. He is traitor to his own people and culture. Btw, I do not know how many people here can read Chinese. But Liu's writing in Chinese sucks. I do not understand people call him a "writer"? No literacy value at all. Feel sorry for the language..He cannot even write properly in Chinese.

Please not be so bias on China.
Of all the parties involved in this fiasco, the Somali pirates seem to be the most honest.

Most people find this hard to believe, but the SpaceX Falcon 9 and Dragon capsule were developed for about one-hundredth the cost NASA is projected to spend on the Ares 1 and Orion capsule. Yes, one-hundredth.

According to a 2009 GAO report to Congress, The Ares 1 and capsule development costs are projected to be about $50 Billion, and they are seven years behind schedule. And this is despite the fact that they use legacy Shuttle and even Apollo hardware.

The media is doing the American people a disservice by glossing over these facts.
You Americans should be ashamed of yourselves for condoning and supporting war and bloodshed in Sudan. The double standards on show here is just appalling.
